title: 93x26: Same Particular Matter and 18 U.S.C. § 207(a)
summary: 18 U.S.C. § 207(a) prohibits a former government employee from making communications to federal agencies and courts concerning funds to resettle a community when the employee was involved negotiating an related agreement while employed by the government.  Section 207(a) does not bar post-employment communications to Congress or legislative staff.
